definition: to pronounce a sentence (after a verdict in a court of law)

sentences.english: The jury convicted him of theft.
sentences.chinese: 陪審團宣判他犯有偷竊罪。

sentences.english: When the jury pronounced him guilty of murder, john did not bat an eye.
sentences.chinese: 當陪審團宣判約翰犯有謀殺罪時，他面不改色。

sentences.english: Lorz was immediately banned for life from any future amateur competition.
sentences.chinese: 洛爾斯隨即被宣判終身不得參加任何業餘比賽。

sentences.english: These charts do not include counts of deserters , those convicted or executed, etc.
sentences.chinese: 這些表格尚不包括逃兵，被宣判及被處決的人，等等。

sentences.english: The court adjourned with no word on the timing of a verdict, lawyers said.
sentences.chinese: 律師說，法庭休庭時並未透露何時宣判。

sentences.english: Both boys pleaded guilty to the theft charge and face sentencing at a later date.
sentences.chinese: 這兩名男孩對該偷盜指控供認不諱，並將被擇日宣判。

sentences.english: The singer was acquitted in 2005 by a jury in Santa Maria, Calif.
sentences.chinese: 該歌星在2005年被聖瑪利亞的陪審團宣判無罪。

sentences.english: BC - The philosopher Socrates is sentenced to death.
sentences.chinese: 公元前399年的今天，哲學家蘇格拉底被宣判死刑。

sentences.english: Uijeongbu District Court will be held on November 1 to pronounce on the case.
sentences.chinese: 議政府地方法院將於11月1日就這一案件作出宣判。

sentences.english: The winning spot kick in the 2005 FA Cup Final shoot-out against Manchester United.
sentences.chinese: 2005年足總盃決賽點球宣判了曼聯的死刑。

sentences.english: Of this case adjudge also ring noisy alarm bell again to fictitious belongings malfeasant .
sentences.chinese: 此案的宣判也給虛擬財產犯罪者再次敲響警鐘。

sentences.english: How does Roslin describe the depth of her disgust at Gaius Baltar's acquittal?
sentences.chinese: 羅斯林如何形容她對宣判波爾塔無罪這件事有多噁心？

sentences.english: Johnson was acquitted by just one vote, narrowly avoiding removal from office.
sentences.chinese: 約翰遜一票之差被宣判無罪，勉強地保留了總統職務。

sentences.english: Judge Hoffman sentenced the seven men to prison.
sentences.chinese: 赫夫曼法官對那七個人宣判入獄。

sentences.english: Unless there is a reprieve the condemned man will hang on Friday .
sentences.chinese: 除非緩刑，那個被宣判的人將於星期五被處絞刑。

sentences.english: Press reports say Ms Tian might be sentenced this week.
sentences.chinese: 新聞報道稱田文華可能於本週被宣判。

definition: judgment (by a court of law)/to pass judgment on/to sentence
on trial (for a crime)/to stand trial
public opinion/public announcement of verdict at a trial
public trial (in a court of law)
